text: November 30, 2011
label: BODY

text: HEADLINES
label: HH3

text: The Employment and Training Administration’s WIA Youth Program Hosts its first
label: BODY

text: Live Chat.  The Employment and Training Administration’s Division of Youth Services
label: BODY

text: hosted a Live Chat entitled “WIA YOUTH TALK” on Tuesday, November 29th.  The Live
label: BODY

text: Chat was designed to provide a real time discussion forum for individuals interested in
label: BODY

text: general WIA youth issues, share promising practices, and hear about what other WIA youth
label: BODY

text: programs are doing around the country.  To view a transcript of the LIVE CHAT and
label: BODY

text: participate in future chats, visit the Youth Connections Community of Practice at:
label: BODY

text: https://youth.workforce3one.org/.
label: BODY

text: The Employment and Training Administration Issues Advisory Notice on the
label: BODY

text: Availability of Assistive Technology Resources for Persons with Disabilities.  The
label: BODY

text: Employment and Training Administration released Training and Employment Notice (TEN)
label: BODY

text: 16-11, which informs the public workforce system about Assistive Technology (AT)
label: BODY

text: resources for persons with disabilities.  The TEN provides a definition of AT, outlines the
label: BODY

text: types of AT, and summarizes funding sources.  To view the TEN, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://wdr.doleta.gov/directives/corr_doc.cfm?docn=3096.
label: BODY

text: The Employment and Training Administration Publishes Guidance on Selective
label: BODY

text: Service Requirements for Workforce Investment Act and Wagner-Peyser-Funded
label: BODY

text: programs.  The Employment and Training Administration has released Training and
label: BODY

text: Employment Guidance Letter (TEGL) 11-11, which provides information on the Selective
label: BODY

text: Service registration requirements for Workforce Investment Act-funded services established
label: BODY

text: by the Workforce Investment Act (WIA) § 189(h), codified at 20 CFR 667.250, and the
label: BODY

text: Military Selective Service Act (50 U.S.C. App. 453), codified at 32 CFR Part 1605. To view
label: BODY

text: the TEGL, visit:  http://wdr.doleta.gov/directives/corr_doc.cfm?docn=9313.
label: BODY

text: U.S. Departments of Education and Defense to Launch “Learning Registry” Tools
label: BODY

text: and Community.  The U.S. Departments of Education and Defense announced the launch
label: BODY

text: of “Learning Registry,” an open source community and technology system designed to
label: BODY

text: improve the quality and availability of learning resources in education.  The Learning
label: BODY

text: Registry is also a communication system that allows existing educational portals and online
label: BODY

text: systems to publish, consume and share important information about learning resources with
label: BODY

text: each other and the public, while respecting the privacy of individual users.  For further
label: BODY

text: details about the Department of Education's involvement in Learning Registry and related
label: BODY

text: initiatives, contact the Department's Office of Education Technology.  To obtain additional
label: BODY

text: information, visit: http://www.learningregistry.org/.  To view the press release, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.ed.gov/news/press-releases/departments-education-and-defense-launch-
label: BODY

text: learning-registry-tools-and-community.
label: BODY

text: FUNDING ANNOUNCEMENTS
label: HH3

text: U.S. Department of Education Awards TRIO Grants.  The U.S. Department of
label: BODY

text: Education has awarded TRIO Educational Opportunity Centers (EOC) program grants to 128
label: BODY

text: grantees in 44 states and Puerto Rico.  The grants will fund counseling services and
label: BODY

text: information on college admissions to qualified individuals who want to enter, or continue a
label: BODY

text: program of postsecondary education.  To view the press release, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www2.ed.gov/programs/trioeoc/index.html.
label: BODY

text: OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH, YOUNG ADULTS, AND TEACHERS
label: HH2

text: The Brown Rudnick Charitable Foundation Corp. Unveils New Grant Program
label: BODY

text: Designed to Help Inner-City Educators.  The Brown Rudnick Charitable Foundation
label: BODY

text: Corp. is accepting applications for its Community Grant Program.  The program was created
label: BODY

text: to support frontline educators and will subsidize small, concrete projects to improve inner-
label: BODY

text: city education in Boston, Hartford, Providence, or New York City.  Eligible applicants must
label: BODY

text: be a "frontline educational worker" who is involved in education or a related field in one of
label: BODY

text: the noted communities eligible for grants.  To obtain additional information and an
label: BODY

text: application, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.brownrudnickcenter.com/foundation/communitygrant.asp.
label: BODY

text: Deadline: Rolling.
label: BODY

text: The Alliance for Young Artists & Writers Invites Entries for its Scholastic Art &
label: BODY

text: Writing Awards.  The Alliance for Young Artists & Writers is accepting entries from
label: BODY

text: creative teens for its 2012 Scholastic Art & Writing Awards.  The awards are designed to
label: BODY

text: recognize talented teen artists and writers in the United States and Canada.  Applicants are
label: BODY

text: invited to submit work in twenty-eight categories of art and writing, including film and
label: BODY

text: animation, video game design, sculpture, photography, fashion design, poetry, journalism,
label: BODY

text: humor, dramatic script, and science fiction.  Eligible applicants must be students in grades
label: BODY

text: 7-12 in a public, private, parochial, home-school, or out of school program in the U.S. or
label: BODY

text: Canada, or in an American school abroad.  Fifteen graduating high school seniors will be
label: BODY

text: awarded with Portfolio Gold Medals, which include a $10,000 scholarship.  To obtain
label: BODY

text: additional information and an application, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.artandwriting.org/.  Deadline:  December 15; January 15, 2012.
label: BODY

text: Youth Service America and Sodexo Foundation Invites Applications for its Sodexo
label: HH3

text: Youth Grants.  Youth Service America and Sodexo Foundation are accepting applications
label: BODY

text: for its Sodexo Youth Grants.  The grants are designed to recognize service projects that
label: BODY

text: engage students' peers, friends, families, neighbors, Sodexo employees, and other
label: BODY

text: community members in creative youth-inspired solutions to ending childhood hunger in their
label: BODY

text: communities.  Eligible applicants must be between the ages of 5 and 25.  Awardees will
label: BODY

text: receive $500.  To obtain additional information and an application, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.ysa.org/grants/sodexoyouth/.  Deadline:  January 17, 2012.
label: BODY

text: Youth Resource Connections
label: HH3

text: Technical Assistance Update for November 2011
label: BODY

text: PeyBack Foundation Accepting Applications for At-Risk Youth Programs in Indiana,
label: BODY

text: Louisiana, and Tennessee.  The PeyBack Foundation is accepting applications for its
label: BODY

text: 2012 PeyBack Foundation Grant.  This grant is designed to recognize programs that have a
label: BODY

text: direct benefit to children through relationships and activities.  Eligible applicants must be
label: BODY

text: nonprofit 501(c)(3) organizations serving economically disadvantaged children between the
label: BODY

text: ages of 6 and 18 in Indiana, Tennessee, and the New Orleans metropolitan area.  Awards
label: BODY

text: will range up to $15,000.  To obtain additional information and an application, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.peytonmanning.com/2012-peyback-foundation-grant-application-now-
label: BODY

text: available.php.  Deadline:  February 1, 2012.
label: BODY

text: PUBLICATIONS
label: HH3

text: Career Clusters:  Forecasting Demand for High School through College Jobs, 2008-
label: BODY

text: 2018.  This report developed by Anthony P. Carnevale, Nichole Smith, James R. Stone III,
label: HH3

text: Pradeep Kotamraju, Bruce Seuernagel, and Kimberly A. Greeen, identifies 16 career clusters
label: BODY

text: that represent the full array of related occupational opportunities and education
label: BODY

text: requirements.  Report findings indicate that for those with high school diplomas, decent jobs
label: BODY

text: still exist, but there are not enough to go around.  Only one in three of high school-level
label: BODY

text: jobs will pay wages of $35,000 or more; in some cases, with experience, these jobs can
label: BODY

text: provide wages up to $50,000.  In addition to the full national report, Career Clusters
label: BODY

text: contains an executive summary and a state-level analysis of jobs by career cluster.  All
label: BODY

text: three documents are available online at:  http://cew.georgetown.edu/Clusters.
label: BODY

text: Federal Education Tax Benefits:  Who Receives Education Tax Benefits and the
label: BODY

text: Effect These Benefits Have on the Price of College Attendance?  This report
label: BODY

text: developed by the U.S. Department of Education’s National Center for Education Statistics at
label: BODY

text: the Institute of Education Sciences, applies IRS rules and data to a nationally representative
label: BODY

text: sample of 2007–08 undergraduates to estimate who received education tax benefits and
label: BODY

text: looks at the extent to which these benefits shaped their price of college attendance.  To
label: BODY

text: view the report, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://nces.ed.gov/pubsearch/pubsinfo.asp?pubid=2012212.
label: BODY

text: Who Enrolls in Dual Enrollment and Other Acceleration Programs in Florida High
label: BODY

text: Schools?  This study developed by Angela Estacion, Bridget A. Cotner, Stephanie D’Souza,
label: BODY

text: Chrystal A.S. Smith, and Kathryn M. Borman, examines dual enrollment programs in Florida
label: BODY

text: (collaborative programs allowing high school students to enroll in college-level courses and
label: BODY

text: earn credit toward both a high school diploma and a college degree or a career preparatory
label: BODY

text: certificate) and compares them with other acceleration programs offered, such as Advanced
label: BODY

text: Placement (AP), International Baccalaureate (IB), and Advanced International Certificate of
label: BODY

text: Education (AICE).  The study also describes the number and characteristics of grade 11 and
label: BODY

text: 12 students enrolled in acceleration programs overall and by district during 2006/07 and it
label: BODY

text: examines dual enrollment partnerships between high schools and colleges in nine sample
label: BODY

text: school districts.  To view the study, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://ies.ed.gov/ncee/edlabs/projects/project.asp?ProjectID=288.
label: BODY

text: Youth Resource Connections
label: HH3

text: Technical Assistance Update for November 2011
label: BODY

text: PROGRAM RESOURCES
label: HH3

text: On November 29, the Bureau of Labor Statistics hosted a Webinar entitled:  Overview of
label: BODY

text: the BLS National Longitudinal Surveys Program.  This webinar featured the U.S.
label: BODY

text: Bureau of Labor Statistics National Longitudinal Surveys.  Assistant Director Jay
label: BODY

text: Meisenheimer provided an overview of the Bureau of Labor Statistics National Longitudinal
label: BODY

text: Surveys program, the population groups that have been surveyed by BLS, and the types of
label: BODY

text: information collected in the surveys.  Other topics discussed included:  Who uses NLS data?,
label: BODY

text: examples of the types of research questions that have been examined using NLS data, and
label: BODY

text: how to obtain NLS data and documentation.  To view and listen to the archived Webinar,
label: BODY

text: visit:  http://apdu.org/.
label: BODY

text: National Center for Educational Statistics Announces Release of High School
label: BODY

text: Career/Technical Education Participation Web Tables.  The National Center for
label: BODY

text: Educational Statistics (NCES) released a set of six tables that presents information on the
label: BODY

text: participation of public high school graduates of the class of 2009 in career/technical
label: BODY

text: education (CTE).  The tables also include the percentage of graduates who earned credits in
label: BODY

text: CTE overall, as well as in various occupational areas within CTE, and the average number of
label: BODY

text: credits earned in CTE and in occupational areas.  Three tables focus on graduates in 2009,
label: BODY

text: and three tables look at participation trends from 1990 to 2009.  To view the tables, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://nces.ed.gov/surveys/ctes/tables/index.asp?LEVEL=SECONDARY.
label: BODY

text: Federal Communications Commission Offering Low-Cost Broadband & Computers
label: BODY

text: for Students & Families.  The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) will launch
label: BODY

text: "Connect to Compete," an initiative to bring low-cost broadband and computers to millions
label: BODY

text: of low-income Americans, in the spring of 2012.  Under this initiative, families eligible for
label: BODY

text: the National School Lunch Program can receive discounted monthly broadband internet, a
label: BODY

text: computer, and free digital literacy training.  To obtain additional information, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://www.fcc.gov/blog/low-cost-broadband-and-computers-students-and-families.
label: BODY

text: WEB SITE
label: HH2

text: National Center for Educational Statistics Announces Release of New State-Level
label: BODY

text: Data on State Education Reforms Website.  The National Center for Educational
label: BODY

text: Statistics announced the release of new state-level data on open enrollment policies
label: BODY

text: available on the State Education Reforms website.  The State Education Reforms website,
label: BODY

text: which draws primarily on data collected by organizations other than NCES, compiles and
label: BODY

text: disseminates data on state-level education reform efforts in five areas:  1) Accountability;
label: BODY

text: 2) Assessment and standards;3) Staff qualifications and development; 4) State support for
label: BODY

text: school choice and other options; and 5) Student readiness and progress through school.  To
label: BODY

text: view the Web site, visit:  http://nces.ed.gov/programs/statereform/.
label: BODY

text: CALENDAR OF EVENTS
label: HH2

text: March 4-7.  Tampa, FL.  University of South Florida 25th Annual Children’s Mental Health
label: BODY

text: Research & Policy Conference.  To obtain additional information, visit:
label: BODY

text: http://cmhtampaconference.com/.
label: BODY

text: NOTICE:
label: HH3

text: The Employment and Training Administration is interested in hearing about new
label: BODY

text: and innovative approaches which bring employers, educators and workforce
label: BODY

text: systems professionals together to serve our communities’ youth.  If you would like
label: BODY

text: to share projects or programs in your area, please e-mail your information to the
label: BODY

text: Division of Youth Services at youth.services@dol.gov.
label: BODY

text: Thank you.
label: BODY

text: not take responsibility for non endorsed DOL/ETA resources included in the YRC.
label: BODY
